newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Chairman of HK's overground railway to stand down.
newsitem.headline: Chairman of HK's overground railway to stand down.

text.p: The chairman and chief executive of Hong Kong's Kowloon-Canton Railway Corp (KCRC), Kevin Hyde, will not seek another term when his contract expires on December 23, the government said on Wednesday.
Hyde joined KCRC as chairman and chief Executive on December 24, 1990 and is now serving his second three-year term at the helm of the public corporation.
The governement said it would engage headhunters to find a successor.
A KCRC spokesman said Hyde was leaving for personal reasons and had informed the goverment that six years was long enough for the job and it was time to move on.
